COVIDCurve

IMPORTANT NOTES

⚠️ This model has planned development and is not guaranteed to be 100% backwards compatible (e.g. parameter names may be extended, changed, etc). Version updates that are not backwards compatible will be noted in the NEWS.md file and signaled with major version changes.

⚠️ This package depends on the R-package DrJacoby version 1.2.0.

Installation & Use

The purpose of this package is to provide a framework to fit age-specific infection fatality ratios (IFRs) in an epidemic that is using serologic data to estimate prevalence. The model was originally designed in response to the COVID-19 pandemic (hence the name).

Accurate inference of the IFR based on serological data is challenging due to a number of factors that can bias estimates away from the true value, including: (1) the delay between infection and death, (2) the dynamical process of seroconversion and seroreversion, (3) potential differences in age-specific attack rates, and (4) serological test characteristics. These delay-distributions and serologic test characteristics are expected to cause both shifts in when deaths are observed as well as when and how many true infections are observed, which will then affect the IFR. This framework is summarized in the conceptual diagram below.

Please see the vignettes for installation and use instructions. Thank you for your interest in our package!
